title: When YOU LOSE Your BRAKES!!! In the RAIN | American Truck Simulator #shorts #ats #simulator

subtasks: Approach the hay bales.
Lift the tailgate of the trailer.
Position the trailer adjacent to the haystack.
Grab a hay bale with both hands.
Lift the hay bale onto the trailer bed.
Repeat until all hay is loaded.

tasks.task: Attaching the trailer to the tractor.
subtasks: Approach the tractor.
Position the trailer hitch near the tractor's rear end.
Connect the trailer tongue to the tractor's hitch.
Secure the coupling with safety chains or locks.

tasks.task: Driving the tractor with the trailer to the field.
subtasks: Sit in the tractor seat.
Adjust the steering wheel for comfortable grip.
Engage the transmission to move the tractor.
Operate the steering wheel to guide the tractor and trailer.
Adjust speed as necessary to maintain control.
Operate the hay割grass machine attached to the tractor.
Guide the machine over the hay to cut it.
Direct the cutter to traverse the entire field.
Overlap passes slightly for coverage.

tasks.task: Stacking the freshly cut hay into a haystack.
subtasks: Drive the tractor and trailer into the field.
Align the trailer with the cut hay.
Lift hay bales onto the trailer as they are formed.
Repeat stacking until the haystack is built.

tasks.task: Driving the tractor with the full trailer back to the barn.
subtasks: Proceed back to the barn with the hayloaded trailer.
Navigate through the field to reach the exit.
Turn around safely at the field perimeter.
Enter the barn area, parking parallel to the hay storage.
Decouple the trailer from the tractor.
Position the trailer near the hay storage area.
Lift the tailgate again.
Step onto the trailer to access the hay.
Unstack the hay bales from the trailer.
Carry each bale into the barn and place it in hayloft.

tasks.task: Cleaning up after the haymaking process.
subtasks: Assess the area for any dropped hay or debris.
Move the tractor and trailer to a cleaning area.
Use a brush or broom to sweep up any leftover hay.
Return any tools to their proper storage locations.
